name: Useless Facts About Water Quiz | Physical Geography | 10 Questions

questions.text: What US state has the most lakes?
questions.explanation:
Alaska.

	Alaska has over 3 million lakes, Wisconsin and Minnesota follow.

questions.text: Where is the world's shortest river located?
questions.explanation:
USA.

	Located in Oregon, USA, the 'D' river runs between Devil's Lake and the Pacific Ocean and is only 120 feet long.

questions.text: What is the largest lake in the world?
Bill Clinton signed into effect a law specifying Lake Champlain, Vermont, as the sixth Great Lake?
Char-gogga-gogg-manchaugg-agogg-chabuna-gonga-maugg is the name of a lake in New England. What is it more commonly known as?
questions.explanation:
Lake Webster.

	It means, 'You fish on your side, I fish on mine, Nobody fishes in the middle. '

questions.text: Under a 2 mile thick layer of ice at the South Pole, is an unfrozen lake the size of Lake Ontario?
The state of Michigan has a shoreline longer than the Eastern shoreline of the USA (Eastern shoreline running from Maine to the tip of Florida)?
questions.explanation:
True.

	The Michigan shoreline is 3100 miles.

questions.text: What is the deepest lake in the world?
Where is the deepest lake in the world located?
You could stand two Empire State buildings on top of one another and they would equal the depth of the deepest lake?
questions.explanation:
False.

	Actually it would take four (1637 meters).
